section.title: Gist of Functions: Definition and Notation

subsection.title: Defining a Function
subsection.p: A function function is a rule that may be in the form of a graph, or a table of values or a formula. It may even be a sentence or a set of instructions. A function takes an input value and uses the rule to create an output value.
Function notation functionnotationnotationfor functions looks like this: f(\text{input})=\text{output}

But, instead of writing the words input and output we usually use variables, like x and y. Then we define in words what the variables actually mean or represent. Most often the notation will look something like this: f(x)=y

Inside the parentheses is the independent variablevariableindependentindependent variable, like x, and outside the parentheses, on the other side of the equals sign, is the dependent variablevariabledependentdependent variable, like y.

statement.p:

li.p: The correct answer is . We were told that the function takes the area as the input, so the area must be in the parentheses.
The correct answer is . This function uses the area of the circle as the input, and the radius depends on the area.
The correct answer is . The number 5.64 was the output of the function which is the radius of the circle. The radius of a circle must have a length unit.

Therefore, the efficiency is a function of the speed. Using function notation we could write an equation saying the same thing: E=f(s)
The input is the speed, s, and the output is the efficiency, E.
The efficiency of the car is given by the height of the graph. Therefore f(35) = 28 means, The efficiency of the car traveling at 35 is 28.

subsection.title: Inputs have unique outputs
subsection.p: An important property of functions is that any single input value can only have one output value. For instance, the car can only have one efficiency at a given speed. The car cannot get 10 and 20 simultaneously.

However, it is possible there are multiple inputs that give you the same output. From the graph we see that a fuel efficiency of 25 can be attained by traveling at a speed of about 20 and also at about 70.

statement.p: Suppose f is a function. Which of the following situations are possible?

solution.p: The correct answer is . A function cannot have the same input value giving two different output values. However, it may have two different input values giving the same output value.

subsection.title: Describing functions with intervals
subsection.p: A function may have many different characteristics: its output values may increase or decrease, its graph may curve up or curve down, it may have positive outputs or negative outputs. When describing these characteristics for a function, we typically refer to an intervalinterval (connected part) of the input axis, or a particular value of the input where something interesting occurs.

subsection.p: Using our efficiency example in Figure, the fuel efficiency increases (goes up) between 5 and 55 then decreases (goes down) for speeds between 55 and 75. Also, the efficiency is lowest at about 5 and highest at about 55.
Any connected portion of the horizontal (speed) axis or the vertical (efficiency) axis is called an interval.interval It is important to be able to correctly describe an interval.

We could use an inequalityinequality to describe the interval where the efficiency function is increasing: 5\lt s\lt55. This means that as the car's speed changes from 5 to 55, the efficiency is increasing.

Another characteristic we can describe with inequalities is the concavityconcavity of a function. We say a function is concave up if its graph curves upward from left to right, and that it is concave down if it curves downward from left to right. We can see that the efficiency graph in Figure is:
concave down for 5\lt s\lt60.
concave up for 60\lt s\lt75.

subsection.title: Evaluate versus Solve
subsection.p: The word evaluateevaluate means to use a known input value to find the output value. Evaluating a function looks like this:f(25)It means, Find the result of choosing 25 as the input. The expression f(25) represents the output 27, which we can see from the graph in Figure.

Solvesolve means the output is already known and we are trying to find all the possible inputs that give us that output. These input values are called solutionssolution of the equation. For instance, we may be asked to Solve f(s)=25.
This means that we are to find all input values (solutions) that would give us the output 25.
Using the graph of the efficiency function in Figure, we see that the equation f(s)=25 has two solutions: s = 20 and s = 70. There are two speeds at which the car has an efficiency of 25.

In fact, solving graphically is often a preferred method of solving equations becuase the output is essetially the height of the graph. So when we solve f(s) = 25 graphically, we are asking What values of s make the graph 25 units high?

Use the graph to:
Evaluate T(77).

solution.p: To graphically find these answers, visualize arrows and guidelines on the graph. To find T(77), recognize that 77 is an input value, and so you must identify it on the horizontal axis. From there, move up, then left to the vertical axis, where you land at about 25. So T(77)\approx25.

A similar process in reverse is used to solve T(F)=-22. Recognize that -22 is an output, and so you must identify it on the vertical axis. From there, move left, then up to the horizontal axis, where you land at about -8. So the solution is F\approx-8.

subsection.title: Average Rate of Change
subsection.p: This a very important topic of this course. You will see it over and over again in various forms. Basically it means slope, but it's more than that. It's also a notation and a concept that sets the stage for calculus.
From the car's efficiency function (Figure) we know f(5)=10 which means at 5 the efficiency is 10.
We also know that f(25)=27 which means at 25 the efficiency is 27.
Therefore, as the speed increased from 5 to 25, the car's efficiency increased from 10 to 27. On average the efficiency changed by 17 while the speed changed by 20.
We can use this information to calculate the average increase in efficiency over the increase in speed.

The little triangle symbol \Delta is also very important. It means, change in. Therefore \Delta f means change in efficiency and \Delta s means change in speed. Together the symbol \frac{\Delta f}{\Delta s} is called average rate of change.

subsection.title: Units
subsection.p: Units are the names of the quantities we are counting. They give meaning to the numbers or values we use in an expression. When you measure the width of a room the tape measure might count 10.5. The number 10.5 is the value and is the units.
In this example the units of efficiency are (miles per gallon) and the units of speed are (miles per hour). Therefore the average rate of change for this example will have units of .
As you see, because slope is just rise over run the units of the average rate of change are miles per gallon over miles per hour.
